* Represents a command that adds a task to the task list.
* This class provides a common implementation for commands that involve adding tasks,
* including printing the total count of tasks in the list after the operation.
public abstract class AddCommand implements JBotCommand {
* Executes the command using the provided input string.
* After adding the task, prints the total number of tasks in the task list.
* @param input The user input string containing the command and its arguments.
System.out.printf("Now you have %1$s tasks in the list.\n", count);
* Represents a command that terminates the application.
* This command prints a farewell message and then closes the application.
* Implements {@link JBotCommand} to adhere to the command interface.
private static final ByeCommand instance = new ByeCommand();
* Returns the singleton instance of {@link ByeCommand}.
* Executes the Bye command using the provided input string.
* Prints a farewell message and invokes {@link JBot#close()} to terminate the application.
* @param input The user input string. This parameter is not used in this implementation.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Represents a command that adds a Deadline task to the task list.
* This command creates a new {@link DeadlineTask} from the provided input, adds it to the task list,
* and prints a confirmation message with the added task.
* Extends {@link AddCommand} to provide common functionality for adding tasks.
private static final DeadlineCommand instance = new DeadlineCommand();
* Returns the singleton instance of {@link DeadlineCommand}.
* Executes the Deadline command using the provided input string.
* Creates a new {@link DeadlineTask} from the input, adds it to the task list,
* and prints a confirmation message with the added task.
* @param input The user input string containing the command and its arguments.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
* Represents a command that deletes a task from the task list.
* This command removes a task at the specified index from the task list and prints a confirmation message
* with the removed task. Extends {@link AddCommand} to provide common functionality for adding tasks.
private static final DeleteCommand instance = new DeleteCommand();
* Returns the singleton instance of {@link DeleteCommand}.
* Executes the Delete command using the provided input string.
* Removes the task at the index specified in the input from the task list,
* and prints a confirmation message with the removed task.
* @param input The user input string containing the command and index of the task to be deleted.
* Represents a command that adds an Event task to the task list.
* This command creates a new {@link EventTask} from the provided input, adds it to the task list,
* and prints a confirmation message with the added task.
* Extends {@link AddCommand} to provide common functionality for adding tasks.
private static final EventCommand instance = new EventCommand();
* Returns the singleton instance of {@link EventCommand}.
* Executes the Event command using the provided input string.
* Creates a new {@link EventTask} from the input, adds it to the task list,
* and prints a confirmation message with the added task.
* @param input The user input string containing the command and its arguments.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
* Represents a command that finds tasks by searching for a keyword
private static final FindCommand instance = new FindCommand();
/** Private constructor to enforce singleton pattern. */
* Returns the singleton instance of FindCommand.
* Executes the find command, searching for tasks that contain the
* specified keyword in their descriptions. Prints the matching tasks.
* @param input the user input containing the find command and keyword.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Represents a command in the JBot application.
* Each command implements this interface and provides the logic for executing the command based on user input.
* Executes the command using the provided input string.
* @param input The user input string containing the command and its arguments.
* Represents a command that lists all tasks in the task list.
* This command retrieves and prints all tasks from the task list, displaying their indices and details.
* Implements {@link JBotCommand} to adhere to the command interface.
private static final ListCommand instance = new ListCommand();
* Returns the singleton instance of {@link ListCommand}.
* Executes the List command using the provided input string.
* Prints all tasks in the task list, each with its index and details.
* @param input The user input string containing the command (not used in this implementation).
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Represents a command that marks a specific task as done.
* This command updates the status of a task in the task list to completed.
* Implements {@link JBotCommand} to adhere to the command interface.
private static final MarkCommand instance = new MarkCommand();
* Returns the singleton instance of {@link MarkCommand}.
* Executes the Mark command using the provided input string.
* Marks the task at the specified index as done and prints a confirmation message.
* @param input The user input string containing the command and the task index.
*              The index is expected to be the second part of the input string.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Represents a command that adds a ToDo task to the task list.
* This command creates a new {@link ToDoTask} from the provided input, adds it to the task list,
* and prints a confirmation message with the added task.
* Extends {@link AddCommand} to provide common functionality for adding tasks.
private static final ToDoCommand instance = new ToDoCommand();
* Returns the singleton instance of {@link ToDoCommand}.
* Executes the ToDo command using the provided input string.
* Creates a new {@link ToDoTask} from the input, adds it to the task list,
* and prints a confirmation message with the added task. If the description is empty,
* @param input The user input string containing the command and its arguments.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
* Represents a command that unmarks a specific task as not done.
* This command updates the status of a task in the task list to not completed.
* Implements {@link JBotCommand} to adhere to the command interface.
private static final UnmarkCommand instance = new UnmarkCommand();
* Returns the singleton instance of {@link UnmarkCommand}.
* Executes the Unmark command using the provided input string.
* Unmarks the task at the specified index as not done and prints a confirmation message.
* @param input The user input string containing the command and the task index.
*              The index is expected to be the second part of the input string.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* A DeadlineTask includes a name and a specific deadline date and time.
* Constructs a DeadlineTask with the specified input string.
* The input string must include the task name and deadline in the format 'd/M/yyyy HHmm'.
* @param input The input string containing the task details and deadline.
System.out.println("Invalid date format! Please use 'd/M/yyyy HHmm'.");
* Constructs a DeadlineTask with the specified name and deadline.
* This constructor is intended for deserialization.
* @param name The name of the task.
* @param deadlineString The deadline in ISO-8601 format.
this.deadline = LocalDateTime.parse(deadlineString); // Assuming the deadlineString is in ISO format
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task.
* The format is the task's super string representation followed by the formatted deadline.
* @return A string representation of the deadline task.
DateTimeFormatter outputFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a");
* Returns the deadline as a string in ISO-8601 format.
return this.deadline.toString(); // This returns the ISO-8601 format by default
* Represents a task with a time period between a start and end.
* An EventTask includes a name, start time, and end time for the event.
* Constructs an EventTask with the specified input string.
* The input string must include the task name, start time, and end time in the format 'event /from [start] /to [end]'.
* @param input The input string containing the task details, start time, and end time.
* Returns a string representation of the event task.
* The format is the task's super string representation followed by the start and end times.
* @return A string representation of the event task.
return String.format("%1$s (from: %2$s to: %3$s)", super.toString(), this.getFrom(), this.getTo());
* Returns the start time of the event.
* @return The start time of the event.
* Returns the end time of the event.
* @return The end time of the event.
* Represents an abstract task with a name and a completion status.
* Subclasses should specify the type of task and its specific behavior.
* Returns whether the task is marked as done.
* @return {@code true} if the task is done, {@code false} otherwise.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* @return A string representation of the task.
* Returns the symbol representing the type of task.
* Returns the name of the task.
* Represents a task with a simple description.
* A ToDoTask consists of a name and a status indicating whether the task is done or not.
* Constructs a ToDoTask with the specified input string.
* The input string must include the task description in the format 'todo [description]'.
* @param input The input string containing the task description.
* @throws EmptyToDoDescriptionException If the description is empty.
throw new EmptyToDoDescriptionException("The description of a todo task cannot be empty.");
* A utility class for parsing user input into commands. This class cannot be instantiated.
throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Utility class cannot be instantiated");
* Initializes the command map with the available commands.
* This method should be called before attempting to parse user input.
* Parses the user input and returns the corresponding command.
* @param userInput The input from the user, typically a command string.
* @return The JBotCommand corresponding to the user input.
* @throws InvalidCommandException If the user input does not match any known command.
public static JBotCommand parse(String userInput) throws InvalidCommandException {
* A utility class for managing the storage of tasks in a JSON file.
throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Utility class cannot be instantiated");
* Initializes the storage by setting up the storage file.
* This method should be called before any operations on the storage.
* Retrieves the storage file. Creates the file if it does not exist.
// Create the file if it doesn't exist
System.out.println("An error occurred while creating the file.");
* Updates the storage file with the current list of tasks.
* Converts tasks to JSON format and writes them to the file.
System.out.println("An error occurred while writing to the file.");
* Converts a task to its JSON representation.
* @return The JSON string representing the task.
* Parses the storage file and populates the task list with the data from the file.
* Handles various task types and updates the task list accordingly.
return; // Exit if file is empty
System.out.println("An error occurred while reading the file.");
System.out.println("An error occurred while parsing the JSON.");
* Extracts the value from a field in a string format.
* @param field The field string containing the value.
* A utility class for managing a list of tasks. This class cannot be instantiated.
throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Utility class cannot be instantiated");
* @param list The new list of tasks to set.
* Retrieves a task from the list at the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Retrieves the number of tasks in the list.
* @return The number of tasks in the list.
* Adds a task to the list.
* @param task The task to add to the list.
* Removes a task from the list at the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to remove.
* @return The task that was removed from the list.
* A utility class for handling user interface interactions. This class cannot be instantiated.
throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Utility class cannot be instantiated");
private static final Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
* Closes the scanner used for reading user input.
* Displays a greeting message to the user.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Displays the result of executing a command and the user input.
* @param userInput The input provided by the user.
public static void display(JBotCommand command, String userInput) {
* Reads a line of input from the user.
* @return The line of input read from the user.
* Handles and displays an error message to the user.
* @param e The exception containing the error message.
private static final String VALID_INPUT = "deadline return book /by 2/12/2020 1900";
private static final String VALID_NAME = "return book";
// The constructor prints error messages rather than throwing exceptions
// Here, we are testing that an invalid input does not throw an uncaught exception
String expectedOutput = String.format("[D] [ ]  %s (by: Dec 02 2020, 7:00 pm)", VALID_NAME);
"Expected parse() to throw, but it didn't"
"Expected parse() to throw, but it didn't"
